keyPolicies.policyDescription: Reduce class sizes for 5, 6, and 7-year-olds to a maximum of 30 pupils per class; Guarantee an apprenticeship for every school leaver who gets the basic grades.
Require all firms that get a major government contract and all large firms hiring from outside the EU to offer apprenticeships.
Cut tuition fees from £9,000 to £6,000 to tackle the burden of debt facing the next generation.
Build 200,000 homes a year, with priority for local first-time buyers in Housing Growth Areas.

issues.economy: Require all firms that get a major government contract and all large firms hiring from outside the EU to offer apprenticeships.
issues.education: Reduce class sizes for 5, 6, and 7-year-olds to a maximum of 30 pupils per class; Guarantee an apprenticeship for every school leaver who gets the basic grades.

housing.content: Build 200,000 homes a year, with priority for local first-time buyers in Housing Growth Areas.

images.caption: Labour will build a country where the next generation can do better than the last.
